detailedSummary: Full-stack development combines frontend and backend to create complete applications. The stack includes: frontend (React, Vue, or Angular), backend (Node.js/Express), database (MongoDB, PostgreSQL), and deployment (cloud platforms). Architecture patterns: MVC separates concerns, RESTful APIs enable frontend-backend communication, microservices break applications into services. Development workflow: planning and design, setting up project structure, implementing features incrementally, testing, and deployment. Environment configuration manages different settings for development/production. API integration connects frontend to backend. Error handling provides user feedback. Logging and monitoring track application health. Deployment involves: building for production, setting up servers, configuring databases, and monitoring. DevOps practices automate deployment. Understanding full-stack development enables building complete, production-ready applications from frontend to backend.
whyItMatters: Full-stack development skills are highly valuable - understanding the complete application stack enables building end-to-end solutions and opens more career opportunities.

assignments.title: Build a Full-Stack Application
assignments.description: Create a complete full-stack application from frontend to backend, demonstrating all learned concepts.
tasks: Design and plan a full-stack application architecture
Build a React frontend with routing and state management
Create an Express.js backend with RESTful API endpoints
Integrate a database (MongoDB) for data persistence
Implement authentication, deploy the application, and document the full-stack architecture

quizzes.question: What does 'full-stack' development mean?
options: Combining frontend, backend, database, and deployment to create complete applications
quizzes.explanation: Full-stack development involves working with all layers of an application: frontend (UI), backend (server), database, and deployment infrastructure.

quizzes.question: RESTful APIs enable frontend and backend to communicate by providing standardized endpoints for data exchange.
quizzes.explanation: True. RESTful APIs provide standardized HTTP endpoints that allow frontend applications to communicate with backend services for data exchange.

quizzes.question: What is the typical flow in a full-stack application?
options: User interacts with frontend → Frontend calls API → Backend processes → Database stores/retrieves → Response to frontend
quizzes.explanation: Full-stack flow: user interacts with frontend, frontend makes API calls to backend, backend processes requests and interacts with database, response flows back to frontend.
